CRON scheduler
In order to perform an automatic action in the System, the user needs to configure its launch time.
In the System, the start time of the action is set in the CRON format.
The scheduling setup is done in the
Startup periods
section. This section is accessible after sequentially selecting the following menu items:
Administration → Settings → Scheduler → Running periods
.
In the opened object registry of the
"Schedule (CRON format)" type [SYS_CRON_SCHEDULE]
, create a new instance by clicking the
button on the control panel (for more details, see
working with object registries
).
Next, specify:
Name;
Identifier;
Schedule in CRON format (the System activates fields for entering specific values when selecting corresponding planning periods).
The System will automatically display the entered schedule
in CRON format
.
Manual input of the value in CRON format
is available via
. This format defines values in the following order: [Sec] [Min] [Hour] [Month’s day] [Month’s number] [Week day’s number].
Range of values:
second (0-59);
minute (0-59);
hour (0-23);
day of the month (1-31);
month (1-12);
day of the week (0-6, 0 - Sunday).
At the same time, the designations are used, where:
* – replaces any range value;
The range can be specified using a dash;
For example, the value " 0 0 0 27-31 * *" means "launch at 0 hours 0 minutes on the 27th-31st of each month".
Enumeration is separated by commas;
For example, the value "0 0 3 1,10,20,30 * *" means "launch at 3:00:00 every 1,10,20,30 days of the month".
periodic execution is specified through a slash:
For example, the value "0 */5 * * * *" means "launch every 5 minutes";
the value "0 0 */3 * * *" means "launch every 3 hours".
At the end of setting the schedule, click
or
in the type profile to save the entered data.
The scheduler is set to the
server time (UTC)
.
If the launch period is changed in the current Schedule, the user will need to restart the
action launch schedule
.
